intro: Knautia godetii subsp. lebrunii, commonly known as the Lebrun's globeflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, globular inflorescences composed of numerous small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it contributes to the floral diversity of mountainous landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
